inlineContent.text: somewhere in your app. You must let the view occupy the whole screen.
stating whether to show instructions the app user.

stating whether to show a circling dot before the real test sequence starts. The purpose is to make the app user aware that the test has started and that they should start following the moving green dot with their eyes. This part of the test is not recorded. You can set this flag to
for app users doing the test for the first time. The test sequence is prolonged with approximately two seconds when this flag is set to
updates. The updates should be used by the app to add alignment hints as overlays on the alignment view.
The instruction views provided by the framework show the app user how to perform the test.
You can create your own instruction views and disable the built-in instructions by setting
The animated icons shown in the built-in instruction views can be accessed separately via
(SwiftUI only) if you want to create your own instruction views. The enum
is used to select animation type.
You can customize the colors of the image, by setting the
properties. The following example uses green with 50% opacity for the outline, and yellow for annotations.
Please include the following information when informing the app user about the test:
Tell the app user to hold their phone straight in front of their face
Tell the app user to follow the green dot with their eyes during the test
Tell the app user to hold the phone still during the test
Tell the app user to avoid talking during the test
Tell the app user to keep their eyes open during the test
You can let your new app users try out the test without sending the recording for analysis to the Sightic Analytics backend to make them familiar with how the test works.
The alignment view helps the app user position their face in front of the screen. The face mesh will become green when the framework deems the app user face to be in the correct position.
Add alignment hints and a countdown as overlays on the alignment view using the
as overlay if you don’t want to create your own design for the overlays.

A green moving dot is presented during the test phase. The app user is supposed to follow the dot with their eyes and keep the phone still. The framework records the face of the user during the test phase.
triggers the completion handler back to the app to indicate that the recording has finished.
that is either a success containing
method to send the recorded data to the Sightic Analytics server for analysis.

, you can give the server permission to save the inference input data. The data is used to improve the inference model. The data is anonymized and does not contain any personal information, nor can it be used to identify a real person, or the device that was used to collect the data.
that indicates whether the test subject is deemed to be under the influence of alcohol.
to provide Sightic Analytics with feedback regarding the inference result.

abstract.text: The framework collects blendshapes, gaze estimation and head position of the app user’s face provided by
. The framework also collects device motions. The Sightic Analytics model estimates how well the app user was able to perform on the test based on this and other information. The data is anonymized.
